items.title: Stocks to Buy | Smart trading tips from Rajesh Bhosale for next few sessions
items.description: Rajesh Bhosale, in an interview with ET Now, said that while the week has started on a decent note, post-opening movements have not shown major traction. Rajesh Bhosale notes that with a truncated week and monthly expiry, the market is likely to consolidate before making any significant moves.

items.title: Online gaming ban: How much Nikhil Kamath and Madhusudan Kela lost in Nazara shares
items.description: Nazara Technologies’ sharp 26.6% fall wiped out over Rs 100 crore in combined mark-to-market wealth of Nikhil Kamath and Madhusudan Kela within four sessions, while Rekha Jhunjhunwala had fully exited earlier, avoiding steep losses amid regulatory concerns.

items.title: Shanghai stock benchmark hits new decade high, HK nears 4-year peak
items.description: China and Hong Kong stocks jumped on Monday, led by the rare earth and property sectors, extending the recent bull run as abundant liquidity continued to fuel gains.

items.title: A defence goldmine? Up already 100% this year, Apollo Micro Systems shares rally 4% to hit fresh all-time high
items.description: Shares of Apollo Micro Systems surged 4% on Monday, hitting a lifetime high and gaining nearly 25% in the last five trading sessions. The defence-focused technology company has doubled investors’ wealth since January and delivered over 500% returns since its 2018 listing. It supplies mission-critical systems for India’s submarine programme, aerospace, and homeland security, boosting indigenisation and strategic capabilities.

items.title: TCS, Infosys shares gain over 3% after brokerages' bullish nudge. What's driving the upgrades?
items.description: Shares of TCS and Infosys jumped over 3% after Investec and JP Morgan upgraded ratings with higher targets, citing long-term IT resilience. Analysts see recovery in H2 FY26, driven by AI-led transformation, cost efficiency, and robust order books despite near-term demand pressures.

items.title: Stocks to Buy | Top Trading Ideas: Cipla & Maruti for near-term rally
items.description: Rajesh Palviya, in an interview with ET Now, said that Nifty is expected to remain in the range of 24,800–25,000 over the next few days.

items.title: JK Paper, TNPL and other paper stocks rally to 17% as govt fixes floor price on packaging imports
items.description: Shares of paper companies surged up to 17% on Monday after the government imposed a Minimum Import Price (MIP) on Virgin Multi-layer Paper Board to curb cheaper imports and protect domestic producers. JK Paper, Tamil Nadu Newsprint & Papers, and West Coast Paper led the gains, with heavy trading volumes signaling strong investor interest in the sector.

items.title: European shares retreat after Powell rally, JDE Peet's soars on buyout
items.description: European shares retreated on Monday, having come close to record highs in the previous session on optimism around U.S. monetary policy easing, while shares of JDE Peet's touched a three-year high following a buyout deal.

items.title: Fed rate moves could drive Wall Street rally: Peter McGuire
items.description: Wall Street staged a notable comeback last week, leaving investors weighing the implications of Fed policy, inflation, and labor market signals. The Nasdaq jumped nearly 2%, the S&P 500 rose 1.5%, and the Dow saw strong gains after remarks from Fed Chair Jerome Powell stirred hopes of potential rate cuts.

items.title: Stock picks of the week: 5 stocks with consistent score improvement and return potential of more than 26% in 1 year
items.description: We have seen the positive impact on the street of the promised GST rate rationalisation. Going forward, it is the speed at which this decision is implemented that will determine festive season sales. And that is critical for the earnings of companies that notch up most of their sales in these months. Also, in the coming weeks, keep an eye on the currency market as that would be the lead indicator of what is going to happen in the equity markets. Our selected stocks for today depict a strong upward trajectory in their overall average score which is based on five key pillars: Earnings, fundamentals, relative valuation, risk, and price momentum. This implies that there has been a significant improvement in their market outlook in the given time frame.

items.title: Expert take: Vodafone Idea, Vedanta among 5 stocks to buy this week for upside up to 24%. Here's why
items.description: Nifty started Monday positively, supported by GST reform updates and expectations of Fed rate cuts. Expert Anuj Gupta recommends five stocks—Vodafone Idea, Dabur India, Tata Motors, Reliance Industries, Vedanta—with potential upside of 6–24% in the short-to-medium term. Stop-loss and target levels are suggested for cautious trading.

items.title: F&O Radar | Deploy Bull Call Spread in Nifty for likely gains amid bullish view
items.description: Nifty ended the week at 24,870, up 0.97%, showing bullish momentum above the 20-SMA. Short-term profit booking and geopolitical concerns caused a bearish shift. Traders may consider a Bull Call Spread to benefit from potential rebound while managing risk amid mixed global cues.

items.title: Ethereum jumps nearly 9% in a week to $4,716;  Bitcoin stays range-bound. Here's why
items.description: Ethereum hit a four-year high above $4,920 before easing near $4,750, up 9% in a week. Bitcoin slipped from $117K to $112K after the Fed signals, sparking liquidations. Altcoins traded mixed, with Hyperliquid leading. Market cap hovered near $3.93 trillion, sentiment neutral.

items.title: Valuation & Liquidity: Quantum AMC’s Winning Investment Approach
items.description: George Thomas in an interview to ET Now pointed out that with interest rate cuts, net interest margins for banks may see some moderation in the near term. However, the market has already factored this in. On the positive side, non-performing asset cycles remain benign, keeping credit costs under control. This makes the sector attractive from a valuation standpoint. Within banking, he prefers private sector banks where the upside looks stronger, especially as credit growth is expected to pick up with economic momentum.

items.title: Indian REIT market shows resilience and robust growth: ICRA Analytics
items.description: The Indian REIT market is on a growth trajectory, driven by expanding portfolios, strong occupancy rates, and healthy WALE levels, according to ICRA Analytics. Leading office REITs — Brookfield India REIT, Embassy REIT, and Mindspace Business Parks REIT — show robust fundamentals, tenant retention, and lease stability. Rising investor confidence and supportive regulations position REITs as a compelling income-generating asset class.

items.title: Two Trades for Today: A realty major for an almost 5% rise, a  large-cap commercial service provider stock for 7% gain
items.description: Technical analysis identifies select stocks that may gain momentum even in volatile markets. Here are the technical calls for today.

items.title: These large-caps have ‘strong buy’ & ‘buy’ recos and an upside potential of more than 27%
items.description: At this point of time, both the bulls and bears are pretty much even, though the bias is toward the bulls. The thing that will tilt the balance in favour of the bears is the implementation of the additional 25% tariff on Indian exports to the US on August 27. But we are assuming that better sense will prevail; and, even if they are implemented, we would soon see an India-US trade treaty that would reverse the tariff.  If that happens, the bullish sentiment will get a boost and the tilt will first be toward large-cap stocks. Especially where the quality of the balance sheet is strong and there is little need for further debt for the business.

items.title: Market Trading Guide: IGL, Sagar Cements among 5 stock recommendations for Tuesday
items.description: Equity benchmarks commenced the holiday-shortened trading week on a buoyant note, with both the Nifty 50 and Sensex registering modest gains on Monday. A dovish tilt in commentary from US Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell during his recent address bolstered expectations of a potential rate cut, catalyzing a wave of risk-on sentiment across global equities.Here are 5 stock recommendations for Tuesday

items.title: China Evergrande delisted from Hong Kong stock exchange. Here's all you need to know
items.description: Shares in China Evergrande were removed from the Hong Kong Stock Exchange on Monday, marking another step in the retreat of the giant real estate developer whose downfall contributed to a prolonged crisis in China's property market.

items.title: Stock exchanges urge regulators to crack down on 'tokenised stocks'
items.description: A group representing the world's biggest stock exchanges is urging securities regulators to clamp down on so-called tokenised stocks, arguing that the blockchain-based tokens create new risks for investors and risk damaging market integrity.

items.title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide stock market action on Tuesday
items.description: Indian equities closed higher Monday, led by IT stocks, after Fed Chair Jerome Powell signaled possible rate cuts next month. Optimism was fueled by falling US bond yields and positive domestic factors.

items.title: US stocks tick lower as Powell-led momentum cools
items.description: Wall Street indexes edged lower on Monday as investors reacted to Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's hint of a potential interest-rate cut in September. Upcoming economic data, particularly the jobs report, will be crucial in determining the Fed's decision. Several brokerages have revised their expectations, anticipating a rate cut, while traders await Nvidia's earnings and monitor tariff-related developments.

items.title: Weekly Top Picks: These stocks scored 10 on 10 on Stock Reports Plus
items.description: Stock Reports Plus, powered by Refinitiv, undertakes detailed company analysis for 4,000+ listed stocks. In addition to detailed company analyses, the report also collates analysts’ forecasts and trend analysis for each component. An average score in Stock Reports Plus is calculated by undertaking quantitative analysis of five key investment tools – earnings, fundamentals, relative valuation, risk, and price momentum.

items.title: Paper stocks: A classic case of tactical Vs long-term investing: 9 stocks from different segments of the paper sector
items.description: Which is a better sector to invest in? A sector that requires government support in terms of policy, or one that does not require any such support? Obviously, the second one. Now, take the above as a guiding principle and decide whether one should look at paper stocks or not. But remember: Not every stock is for long-term investing. There are some sectors where one needs to be tactical. And tactical investing is not as simple as it appears to be. It requires the application of many skills at the same time.

items.title: Nifty rejig: Ola Electric, Ather Energy, SWSolar among 46 smallcap stocks to be impacted. Check details
items.description: The National Stock Exchange’s September 2025 semi-annual review is set to bring sweeping changes to the Nifty Smallcap 250 index, with 46 stocks set to be impacted. The rejig, effective September 30 after adjustments on September 29, will drive significant passive flows as funds tracking the index adjust their portfolios.

items.title: Stock Radar: NYKAA breaks out from Cup & Handle pattern in August 2025; check target & stop loss for long positions
items.description: NYKAA, or FSN E-Commerce Ventures Ltd, has exhibited a bullish Cup & Handle pattern on weekly charts, signaling potential for upward movement. Experts suggest short-term traders consider buying with a target of Rs 255. The stock rebounded after testing its 100-DMA in March 2025, supported by positive momentum and favorable RSI and MACD indicators.

items.title: Paytm, Nykaa, Delhivery among 7 midcap stocks that hit 52-week highs & rallied up to 20% in a month
items.description: On Monday, the benchmark Sensex advanced by approximately 329 points, closing at 81,635. Amid a broader market upswing, seven stocks from the BSE Midcap index surged to their 52-week highs — marking their strongest levels in the past year. Such breakouts are often viewed by traders and investors as bullish signals, reflecting strong upward momentum and the possibility of further gains ahead.

items.title: AI superstar Nvidia could eclipse India’s entire market cap if Cantor’s target price is met
items.description: Nvidia, valued at $4.3 trillion, could surpass India’s Rs 5.21 trillion equity market if shares hit $240. Driven by AI chip dominance, the stock has surged 1,400% since 2022. Analysts remain bullish ahead of Q2 earnings, with China growth and AI demand in focus.

items.title: Bungled trade seen as showing weakness of India’s block trade system
items.description: A $300 million trading error by Avendus Capital in Clean Science shares exposed flaws in India’s block deal system. SEBI has proposed rule changes, including tripling discount limits and raising trade size thresholds, to prevent future mishaps.

items.title: Market Wrap: Sensex climbs 329 points, Nifty nears 25,000 as IT stocks rally on Fed rate-cut hints
items.description: Indian benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty closed higher Monday, lifted by IT shares after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell signaled the U.S. central bank could cut interest rates as soon as next month.

items.title: Only if one is ready to take a calculated risk: 5 mid-cap stocks from different sectors with an upside potential of over 22%
items.description: The stock market is about managing uncertainty, but there are times when this quotient is off the charts. In such times, it is better to use both quantitative and qualitative measures to reduce risk. Because, in equity as an asset class, risk cannot be eliminated. To reduce risk, look at companies with a certain level of RoCE and low debt. Check whether the company pays dividends regularly. Together, these things show the ability of a management to handle adverse business cycles. In our list today there is one company which has not paid dividends. But being in a sector like infrastructure, it is expected that dividends will not come as execution of projects requires a good amount of working capital.
